title: Burden of Disease
text:
Overview
The Burden of Disease section quantifies the health impact of notifiable conditions beyond simple case counts. Three complementary indicators are computed:







Indicator
Meaning




YLL (Years of Life Lost)
Premature mortality impact, computed from SA life tables and vital registration data


DALYs (Disability-Adjusted Life Years)
Combined mortality (YLL) + morbidity (YLD) burden


ASR (Age-Standardised Rates)
Rates adjusted for population age structure to enable fair comparisons across provinces









ImportantMethodological Note



All estimates depend on data quality and completeness. Assumptions, disability weights, and life table sources are documented on the Methods page.

text:

title: Burden of Disease
text:
DALYs
Coming soon â€” Disability-adjusted life years combining YLL with YLD estimates. Disability weights sourced from GBD 2019.

text:
Age-Standardised Rates
Coming soon â€” rates per 100 000 adjusted using the WHO World Standard Population, enabling province-to-province and time-period comparisons.

title: Predictive Modelling â€“ Vaccine-Preventable Conditions
text:
Animated Forecast Outlook
The rolling forecast shows how the predicted trajectory shifted each week as new data arrived. Each coloured line represents a forecast made on a different snapshot date; vertical markers show where each snapshotâ€™s data ended.
This visualisation helps assess:

Forecast stability â€“ are successive predictions consistent?
Outbreak acceleration â€“ are newer forecasts trending higher?
Early warning â€“ divergence between snapshots signals emerging outbreaks.



No rolling forecast data available. Run `Rscript R/run_forecasts.r` to generate.

TableÂ 1: How to read the forecast outputs



ElementWhat it meansSuggested actionMedian lineMost likely trajectory based on current RtMonitor closely; compare to previous snapshots50% CI (dark ribbon)Central range â€“ 1 in 2 chance the true value falls hereNormal operational uncertainty90% CI (light ribbon)Wide range â€“ 9 in 10 chance the true value falls hereIf real counts approach the upper bound â†’ escalateForecast horizon (dashed red)Where observed data ends and prediction beginsPredictions degrade further from this lineRolling snapshots diverging upwardSuccessive forecasts are increasingly pessimisticPossible outbreak acceleration â†’ trigger response protocolsRolling snapshots convergingOutbreak is stabilising or decliningMaintain surveillance; consider de-escalation

title: Predictive Modelling â€“ Vaccine-Preventable Conditions
text:
Effective Reproduction Number (\(R_t\))
The time-varying reproduction number \(R_t\) indicates how many secondary cases each infected person generates on average.

\(R_t > 1\) â†’ epidemic is growing
\(R_t = 1\) â†’ epidemic is stable
\(R_t < 1\) â†’ epidemic is declining



Run `Rscript R/run_forecasts.r` to generate Rt estimates.

title: Predictive Modelling â€“ Vaccine-Preventable Conditions
text:
Updating Forecasts






ImportantStep-by-step instructions to refresh predictions



Forecasts are not computed live during dashboard rendering (they take ~5â€“15 min per condition). Instead, a batch script produces cached .rds files that the dashboard reads.
Prerequisites:

R â‰¥ 4.3 with packages: EpiNow2, data.table, dplyr, lubridate, here, purrr
CmdStan installed (EpiNow2 backend). Install via: cmdstanr::install_cmdstan()
Aggregated surveillance data in data/processed/agg_national.rds (produced by R/prepare_dashboard_data.r)




1. Update the surveillance data
# From the project root
cd /Users/briday/Desktop/SAFETP/CLA/NMC_website/NMC_dashboard
Rscript R/prepare_dashboard_data.r
This reads the latest NMC master dataset and produces:

data/processed/agg_national.rds
data/processed/agg_province.rds
data/processed/agg_district.rds



2. Run the forecast batch
Rscript R/run_forecasts.r
This produces for each vaccine-preventable condition:







File
Contents




forecasts_<condition>.rds
Single-point EpiNow2 summary (Rt, cases, infections)


forecasts_rolling_<condition>.rds
Rolling snapshots for animated outlook


forecasts_meta.rds
Run timestamp and parameters





3. Re-render the dashboard
quarto render by-forecasts/index.qmd
# Or render the full site:
quarto render


Configuration
Edit the constants at the top of R/run_forecasts.r to adjust:



Parameter
Default
Description




HORIZON
21
Days to forecast ahead


LOOKBACK
360
Days of history for each model run


N_REWINDS
8
Number of rolling snapshots


REWIND_STEP
7
Days between snapshots





Adding a new condition

Ensure the condition appears in agg_national.rds (via prepare_dashboard_data.r)
Add disease parameters in R/epinow2_functions.r â†’ disease_params() function
Add the condition name to vp_conditions() in the same file
Re-run Rscript R/run_forecasts.r

title: Predictive Modelling â€“ Vaccine-Preventable Conditions
text:
Methods & Assumptions






NoteTechnical details (click to expand)





Model: EpiNow2 v2.x â€“ a Bayesian semi-mechanistic model that jointly estimates the effective reproduction number (\(R_t\)), infection incidence, and reporting patterns.
Reporting delay: Estimated from the empirical distribution of symptom_date â†’ notification_date in the NMC data (capped at 15 days, fitted via EpiNow2::estimate_delay()). When insufficient data is available, a LogNormal(mean=3, sd=2) prior is used.
Generation time & incubation period: Condition-specific Gamma distributions from published literature. See R/epinow2_functions.r â†’ disease_params() for exact parameters.
Priors: \(R_t\) prior is set at Normal(mean=2, sd=1) for all vaccine-preventable conditions.
Completeness / Timeliness: The NMC is a passive surveillance system; under-reporting varies by condition and province. Forecasts represent reported cases, not true incidence.
Rolling forecast animation: Re-runs the model 8 times (weekly snapshots), each using data up to that snapshot date, to visualise how the forecast evolves as new data arrives.





Source code: R/epinow2_functions.r Â· R/run_forecasts.r Â· Data pipeline: R/prepare_dashboard_data.r

title: Glossary
text:
Key Indicators







Indicator
Definition




Incidence rate
Number of new cases per 100 000 population over a defined period


CFR
Proportion of diagnosed cases that result in death


Rt
Average number of secondary infections caused by one case at time t


YLL
Years of potential life lost due to premature death


YLD
Years lived in less-than-full health due to illness


DALY
Total burden = YLL + YLD â€” one DALY = one year of healthy life lost


ASR
Rate adjusted for age distribution to allow fair comparison between populations


Completeness
Proportion of expected surveillance reports actually received


Timeliness
Time between event occurrence and its entry in the surveillance system

title: Glossary
text:
Epidemiological Terms







Term
Definition




Epicurve
A histogram of case counts over time, used to visualise the course of an outbreak


Signal
A statistical anomaly in surveillance data that warrants investigation


Nowcast
An estimate of current case counts adjusted for reporting delays


Forecast
A probabilistic estimate of future case counts based on current trends


Choropleth
A map in which areas are shaded proportional to a statistical variable


Drilldown
Navigating from a summary view to more granular detail (e.g., province â†’ district)


Baseline
A reference level of disease activity, typically derived from historical data

title: SA NMC Dashboard
text:
This dashboard makes Notifiable Medical Conditions (NMC) data accessible and actionable for public health officials across South Africa. It provides timely insights into disease trends, hotspots, and forecasts to support effective decision-making and resource allocation.
All coding and analysis is open-source â€” any epidemiologist can reproduce the work locally and contribute improvements.

title: SA NMC Dashboard
text:
Dashboard Sections


National Overview
DESCRIPTIVE  In development
High-level surveillance snapshot â€” total cases, top conditions, national epicurve and key indicators.


By Province
DESCRIPTIVE  Active
Provincial summaries with case counts, incidence rates, interactive charts and district drilldown. Includes sub-pages for all 9 provinces.


By Condition
DESCRIPTIVE  Active
Condition-centric view: national epicurves, provincial comparisons, district hotspot tables with export.


Trending & Signals
ANALYTICAL  In development
Signal detection (CUSUM/EARS) for emerging conditions, surge tables, trend sparklines and alert log.


Burden of Disease
ANALYTICAL  Planned
Years of Life Lost (YLL), DALYs and age-standardised rates to quantify health impact beyond case counts.


Forecasts & Scenarios
PREDICTIVE  In development
Short-term EpiNow2 forecasts (1â€“6 weeks), scenario bands, nowcasting with reporting-delay adjustment.


Data Explorer
INTERACTIVE  Planned
Self-service tool: select conditions, dates and locations, then visualise epicurves, maps, statistics and download data.


Data Quality
QUALITY  In development
Reporting completeness by province, submission volume heatmaps, timeliness metrics and validation checks.

title: SA NMC Dashboard
text:
Planned Architecture
The planned structure of the dashboard is as follows:





flowchart TD
    %% ---------- MAIN LAYERS ----------
    A["Home: NMC Epidemiology SA"]

    %% Descriptive
    B["By Province"]
    B1["Province Overview of all conditions"]
    B2["District Drilldown"]
    C["By Condition"]
    C1["National Trends"]
    C2["Province Comparison of condition X"]
    C3["District Hotspots of condition X"]

    %% Interactive
    G["Explorer"]
    G1["Interactive Condition, Date & Location Selector"]
    G2["Epicurve Visualisation"]
    G3["Map Visualisation"]
    G4["Descriptive Statistics"]
    G5["Data Table view and download"]

    %% Analytical
    D["Burden of Disease"]
    D1["YLL â€” life tables & from vital status"]
    D2["DALYs â€” YLL + YLD"]
    D3["ASR â€” age-standardised rates"]

     %%
    E["Trending Conditions"]
    E1["Signal Detection (CUSUM/EARS)"]
    E2["Hotspots (provinceâ†’district)"]
    E3["Analyst Notes & Alert Log"]

    %% Predictive
    F["Forecasts and scenarios"]
    F1["Short-term forecasts (1â€“6 wks)"]
    F2["Scenario bands & seasonality"]
    F3["Nowcasting (delay adjustment)"]

    %% ---------- FLOW ----------
    A --> B --> B1 --> B2
    A --> C --> C1 --> C2 --> C3
    A --> D --> D1 --> D2 --> D3
    A --> G --> G1 --> G2 --> G3 --> G4 --> G5
    A --> E --> E1 --> E2 --> E3
    E --> F --> F1 --> F2 --> F3

    %% ---------- CLASSES ----------
    classDef Descriptive fill:#e6f2ff,stroke:#1d4ed8,stroke-width:1.5px,color:#0b2e78;
    classDef Interactive fill:#e0f7fa,stroke:#00796b,stroke-width:1.5px,color:#004d40;
    classDef Analytical fill:#fff4e5,stroke:#b45309,stroke-width:1.5px,color:#7a3b07;
    classDef Predictive fill:#f3e8ff,stroke:#7e22ce,stroke-width:1.5px,color:#42136a;
    classDef LegendBox fill:#f8fafc,stroke:#94a3b8,color:#334155;

    class B,B1,B2,C,C1,C2,C3, Descriptive;
    class G,G1,G2,G3,G4,G5 Interactive;
    class D,D1,D2,D3,E,E1,E2,E3 Analytical;
    class F,F1,F2,F3 Predictive;

    %% ---------- LEGEND ----------
    subgraph LEG["Legend"]
      direction TB
      L1["Descriptive"]:::Descriptive
      L2["Interactive"]:::Interactive
      L3["Analytical"]:::Analytical
      L4["Predictive"]:::Predictive
    end

    class LEG LegendBox;

    %% ---------- OPTIONAL STYLING ----------
    style A stroke:#0b3a75,stroke-width:2px,fill:#eef2ff,rx:8,ry:8
    style LEG rx:6,ry:6

title: Methods
text:
Data Pipeline
The dashboard data flows through the following pipeline:

Import â€” R/data_import.r reads raw NMC data and reference files
Cleaning & QC â€” deduplication, date validation, district dictionary lookups
Aggregation â€” R/aggregator_national.r produces national, provincial and district summaries
Dashboard preparation â€” R/prepare_dashboard_data.r writes .rds files to data/processed/
Forecasting â€” R/run_forecasts.r + R/epinow2_functions.r produce short-term forecasts
Rendering â€” Quarto renders .qmd pages into the _site/ output directory

title: Methods
text:
Indicator Definitions

Incidence Rate
\[
\text{Incidence} = \frac{\text{Cases}}{\text{Population}} \times 100\,000
\]
Population denominators are from Stats SA mid-year estimates.


Years of Life Lost (YLL)
\[
\text{YLL} = \sum_{i} d_i \times e_i
\]
Where \(d_i\) is the number of deaths at age \(i\) and \(e_i\) is the remaining life expectancy at age \(i\) from the SA life table.


DALYs
\[
\text{DALY} = \text{YLL} + \text{YLD}
\]
Where \(\text{YLD} = \text{prevalent cases} \times \text{disability weight} \times \text{duration}\).


Age-Standardised Rate (ASR)
\[
\text{ASR} = \frac{\sum_{i} w_i \cdot r_i}{\sum_{i} w_i} \times 100\,000
\]
Where \(w_i\) is the WHO standard population weight for age group \(i\) and \(r_i\) is the age-specific rate.

title: Methods
text:
Signal Detection
The Trending section uses:

CUSUM (Cumulative Sum) â€” detects sustained shifts from the expected mean
EARS C1/C2/C3 â€” CDCâ€™s Early Aberration Reporting System algorithms for rapid signal detection

Thresholds and baseline windows are documented in the trending page notes.

title: Methods
text:
Forecasting
Short-term forecasts in the Forecasts section use EpiNow2:

Renewal equationâ€“based model with Rt estimation
Generation interval and incubation period distributions sourced from literature
Forecast horizon: 1â€“6 weeks with 50% and 95% credible intervals
Nowcasting: delay-adjusted counts using empirical reporting delay distributions

title: Methods
text:
Quality Control
See the Data Quality page for detailed metrics. Key checks include:

Completeness â€” proportion of expected reports received by district and week
Timeliness â€” median reporting delay (notification â†’ NMC entry)
Duplicates â€” fuzzy matching on name, date of birth, condition and date of onset
Consistency â€” cross-checks between age, date of onset, and notification date

title: Data Explorer
text:
About the Explorer
The Data Explorer is a self-service tool for epidemiologists and public health officials to query NMC surveillance data interactively. Use the filters below to build a custom view, then visualise or download the results.
